name: Salines Garden Cottages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s funny. Before that last post it would seem that Jean-Phillipe and Saline Gardens are a perfect fit for any guest who has stayed there. (It is perfect to us and Jean-Phillipe has been great!) For those of us who have stayed at Saline Gardens and do consider it such a wonderful place, that last post may be the best thing that will ever happen to us. Now maybe there will be availability next time. :)
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of its increased popularity (and we assume great reviews), availability is already a challenge. My husband and I just returned home from a 3 night stay (we had to move to a second property at more than triple the rate for the final 4 nights, because we booked late with SG). This was our second stay at SG and it was just as lovely as the first. We’ve now visited St Barts the last 4 years, and have stayed at 5 different places – Saline Gardens is not only the least expensive but it is also the most charming, and has been the best overall experience for us.
reviews.title: Very disappointed and will not stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are lovely, especially at night, and the rooms are tastefully and creatively decorated and very comfortable. The location is in one of the prettiest and most convenient parts of the island. When you return after a day at the beach or driving around the island, as soon as the property gate opens and you drive in, the feeling is that you are home.
reviews.title: Perfect in Paradise !

reviews.text: At Saline Gardens, you truly are a welcomed guest. J-P and his wife Laurence know you by name, the breakfast is simple and fresh and a great way to meet some of the other guests. You can totally keep to yourself if you want, or you can join in the semi-official and seemingly impromptu happy hour with your host and other guests. If you want to hear some great story telling and learn about the island, Jean-Phillippe is the perfect host and ambassador – charming, humorous, engaging, and courteous of everyone, regardless of their primary language. It is such a great opportunity to compare notes with others, and receive great advice about restaurants, beaches, excursions and the like.
reviews.title: Caribean Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We believe that Saline Gardens gives you an outstanding experience at a relative fraction of the price of the luxury hotels at which we have tried. Selfishly, we were reluctant to write a great review because we already know how difficult it is to get a room at SG. But if you are lucky enough to get one, we promise you won't regret it, and if we are so lucky, then we hope to see you there. We hope we can stay there again next time for the entire stay in St. Barts.
reviews.title: A Great Value in Wonderful St. Barth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SHHHHHHHH,
reviews.title: The entrance to Nirvana

reviews.title: This place ROCKS!
What a Vacation!
reviews.text: We really want to go back and find the unspoiled, classy, charming, understated luxury that we experienced.

reviews.title: Fantastic for family and friends traveling together
reviews.text: So, keep it quite.

reviews.title: The best kept secret in St. Barth's
reviews.text: We thought we have seen a lot and the best of the Caribbean, since we live in the Caribbean; until......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading numerous positive reviews, we chose to spend four nights at Salines Gardens. The rooms were as described, and the surroundings OK. It was basically a budget place to stay. The breakfast was just a baguette, coffee and croissants. The major disappointment came with the attitude displayed by the owner Jean Philippe. He picked us up as promised from the ferry. Immediately a mood of distraction and disinterest was evident. He had “nanny” problems, and also seemed very preoccupied with local politics. He gave us some general info, and then said that he returns at 6 to help
reviews.title: Salines Has Gotten Complacent

reviews.text: his guests make dinner plans. The one recommendation he gave us – Café Massai was very good, but we learned by reading other posts, they he may be getting a cut from his recommendations, which is deplorable. We had questions about good beaches, which again he answered quickly, and seemed annoyed if we had further needs. He basically never walked, but sort of ran from one thing to another, frequently with his open lap-top as a companion. Unfortunately, I had
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret

reviews.text: a bad fall on the final descent to Colombier beach, and it was necessary to call the Coast Guard and then go to the hospital. He seemed amazed that this could have happened. Mumbling something about
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this being the “first time” this had happened and showed very little concern for the next two days, even though; a nurse had to visit to redress bandages. The towels were never changed. The soap was never replenished, and I had to ask for more toilet paper. He was, at times
reviews.title: Paradise on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rude, and then would backtrack and try to smooth over his responses. Everything was viewed as an inconvenience for him. We left thinking the island were lovely, but staying at Salines Gardens again would never happen again. He seems proud of his reputation, and now rides on a wave of complacency.
reviews.title: Home from home
Impressive! Superb! Perfect for us! Intersting place with intersting people!
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from 7 days at Salines Gardens. This was our second trip to St Barth's and staying with Jean-Philippe and Laurence was Fantastic! SG is a very impressive group of 5 comfortable, well decorated and private cottages with a great balance of private and communal spaces, excellent safety and security, and only a 10 min walk to Saline Beach. Morning breakfasts (baguette, pastry, juice, coffee) around the dip pool were great fun with great conversation and lots of laughs with new people. JP is a very interesting man (Champion surfer, Karate teacher and civic leader) and his recommendations for: beaches, snorkeling, scuba, dinner and entertainment were perfect as he takes a personal interest in each of his guests and made sure we were treated to special service everywhere. We booked a cottage (Padang/Padang) with kitchenette which was very relaxing with an excellent mattress, beautiful bathroom en suite and very cool air conditioning! This is the place from which you can explore St Barth's at your own pace. You can easily spend 5-10 times more and be unhappy on St Barth's. Enjoy Salines Gardens. We did!

reviews.title: Fantastic stay at beautiful Salines Garden Cottages!!
reviews.text: We had a fantastic time at Salines Garden!!

reviews.title: Value vs. Comfort, you must decide.
reviews.text: We choose a cottage with kitchenette, which is great if you want to have a small lunch/dinner to rest from the great restaurants. The room was superb, brand new, clean, clear, calm, nicely decorated. The bathroom was fantastic, with a brand new walk-in shower made of fine material.

reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
reviews.text: The (small) pool is surrounded by tropical vegetation, it's a great place to relax (from the beach), read a book in the shade, or meet the other guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location could not be better: close to what we believe was the nicest beach on St Barths (Salines), close to St Jean, Lorient and Gustavia for visits.
reviews.title: Very Cool

description: Close to St-Barths' finest beach, nested in a blooming tropical garden, five cottages surround a tranquil pool. A thoughtfully refined atmosphere for a relaxed and restorative vacation .A unique place, simply to discover.A delightful exception in St-Barths .
